identified-content.object.title: Advertising (Times Column)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Marketing, Advertising and PR

abstract.p: American Advertising Federation will induct seven people into its Hall of Achievement, which honors executives 40 and younger; they are August Busch IV, Lee Ann Daly, Gary Epstein, Kate Everett-Thorp, Eliot Kang, Richard Kirshenbaum and Anne Lewnes (S)

block.p: The American Advertising Federation in Washington will induct seven people into its Hall of Achievement, which honors executives 40 and younger.

They are August Busch IV, 35, group vice president for marketing and wholesale operations at Anheuser-Busch in St. Louis; Lee Ann Daly, 38, senior vice president for marketing at ESPN in New York, part of the Walt Disney Company; Gary Epstein, 39, president and chief executive at Euro RSCG Tatham in Chicago, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising; Kate Everett-Thorp, 30, president and chief executive at Lot 21 in San Francisco; Eliot Kang, 37, president and chief executive at Kang & Lee Advertising in New York, part of Young & Rubicam; Richard Kirshenbaum, 38, co-chairman at Kirshenbaum Bond & Partners in New York; and Anne Lewnes, 38, vice president and director for the consumer marketing group at Intel in Santa Clara, Calif.
The American Advertising Federation in Washington will induct seven people into its Hall of Achievement, which honors executives 40 and younger.

They are August Busch IV, 35, group vice president for marketing and wholesale operations at Anheuser-Busch in St. Louis; Lee Ann Daly, 38, senior vice president for marketing at ESPN in New York, part of the Walt Disney Company; Gary Epstein, 39, president and chief executive at Euro RSCG Tatham in Chicago, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising; Kate Everett-Thorp, 30, president and chief executive at Lot 21 in San Francisco; Eliot Kang, 37, president and chief executive at Kang & Lee Advertising in New York, part of Young & Rubicam; Richard Kirshenbaum, 38, co-chairman at Kirshenbaum Bond & Partners in New York; and Anne Lewnes, 38, vice president and director for the consumer marketing group at Intel in Santa Clara, Calif.
The executives will be honored on Nov. 8 at a lunch in New York.
